The claim is based on data compiled by G: us, an independent site that tracks the voting record of individual lawmakers and monitors missed votes by each member of Congress.
GovTrack breaks down missed votes into q: and in the second quarter of 2012, Rep. Gwen Moore missed 16.7 percent of the House votes.
The numbers show that Rep: Moore had the highest number of missed votes among Wisconsin's eight-member House delegation in the second quarter.
Rep: Moore's campaign explained that she was dealing with a family crisis during the first part of the year, which may have contributed to her higher number of missed votes.
